name: Austronesian (> Malayo-Polynesian)
1_comment: no examples without emphatic ha' (and without negation)

name: Austronesian (> Malayo-Polynesian > Greater Central Philippine)
1_adjacent_meanings: quite a while ago (with temporal expressions), some more, first, also/too (with perfective aspect), just (with recent-perfective aspect), in addition, ~while ("in successive clauses"),
1_adjacent_meanings_detailed: p. 415-419; quite a while ago ~ already in Turkish, "Pa extends the psychological distance between the two points of time"

name: Austronesian (> Malayo-Polynesian > Oceanic > New Caledonian)
1_comment: see also durative baa (sometimes ambigous with still)
2_comment: "It marks continuative aspect, but also denotes contradictory expectation or presupposition"
2_meaning_under_negation: still not / (+ perfect + seq + neg) no longer

name: Nuclear Trans New Guinea (> Dani)
1_comment: p. 428 with temporal expressions; in all examples inside while-clauses

name: Austroasiatic (> Aslian)
1_comment: borrowing from Malay; means "still" in the pre-predicate position; actually is similar to aux

name: Nuclear Torricelli
1_comment: "like all class 2 particles, it can occur once or twice within the same clause"
